title: The Numerical Invariant Measure of Stochastic Differential Equations With Markovian Switching. (arXiv:1804.02128v2 [math.PR] UPDATED)
description: The existence and uniqueness of the numerical invariant measure of the backward Euler-Maruyama method for stochastic differential equations with Markovian switching is yielded, and it is revealed that the numerical invariant measure converges to the underlying invariant measure in the Wasserstein metric. Under the polynomial growth condition of drift term the convergence rate is estimated. The global Lipschitz condition on the drift coefficients required by Bao et al., 2016 and Yuan et al., 2005 is released. Several examples and numerical experiments are given to verify our theory.
